alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 26 at 5:27PM EDT until April 26 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 525 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen from these slow moving thunderstorms during the last hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area from these slow moving thunderstorms during the next couple of hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a flash flood warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hialeah, Miramar, Miami Gardens, Doral, Miami Lakes, Hialeah Gardens, Medley, Pennsuco, Intersection Krome And U.S. 27, Palm Springs North, Country Club and Miami International Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
